messages.subject: Re: bike tour at conference
messages.msgSnippet: ... want/need ... Oooh, thank you SO much Marji!! Trevor can watch him too...but I m afraid he ll be sacked out from too much fun the night before. I would be
messages.messageBody:
>
> Ren, I'll be happy to watch the wee-est of your wee ones, if you
want/need
> me to while you're out there touring around.
>
> Marji

Oooh, thank you SO much Marji!! Trevor can watch him too...but I'm
afraid he'll be sacked out from too much fun the night before. I
would be eternally grateful. Wee man will probably nurse right before
I leave and be asleep the entire time! :) That's the plan anyway.
Hopefully he won't scare Liam quite so badly this year....sigh.
He plays a bit more nicely now. I hope......

Ren

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] bike tour at conference
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/10/03 9:01:35 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... DH said he has a Lotus 3000R that is 54 cm.. He also has a Bridgestone RB-1. that is 54.. but,
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/10/03 9:01:35 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
starsuncloud@... writes:

> I have a road bike by Giant...the OCR 2 and I think it's a 54 or something.
> It seems like the size I need varies from brand to brand, so do you have one
> that might work? I'm not picky, as long as I can reach the handle bars
> without falling over.
>
> Ren
>

DH said he has a Lotus 3000R that is 54 cm.. He also has a Bridgestone RB-1.
that is 54.. but, it's his "prize bike".. lol.. He was planning riding it
himself. So, if the Lotus is OK, we will put your name on it :-)

Teresa


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] bike tour at conference
messages.msgSnippet: ... Ren, I ll be happy to watch the wee-est of your wee ones, if you want/need me to while you re out there touring around. Marji
messages.messageBody:
At 01:00 8/11/03 +0000, Ren wrote:
>I was just moaning to myself today that I really WISH I had a bike rack!!
>I want to do the tour, but I can't possibly get my bike up there...so ME,
>ME, ME (wildly waving hands).


Ren, I'll be happy to watch the wee-est of your wee ones, if you want/need
me to while you're out there touring around.

Marji

messages.subject: bike tour at conference
messages.msgSnippet: So, if anyone who is traveling by plane, or has no way of transporting thier bike, would like to do the bike tour and needs a bike, just email me and I will
messages.messageBody:
" So, if anyone who is traveling by plane, or has no way of
transporting thier bike, would like to do the bike tour and needs a bike, just

email me and I will bring one for you."

I was just moaning to myself today that I really WISH I had a bike rack!! I want to do the tour, but I can't possibly get my bike up there...so ME, ME, ME (wildly waving hands).
Any Cervelo's? :) Ok, wishful thinking.
I have a road bike by Giant...the OCR 2 and I think it's a 54 or something. It seems like the size I need varies from brand to brand, so do you have one that might work? I'm not picky, as long as I can reach the handle bars without falling over.

Ren
